topic_metadata.title: How to change heading numbering per level?

posts.name: Konstantin Vogler
posts.cooked:
#set heading(numbering: "I. a.")
= Heading 1
== Heading 2
== Heading 3

the output of this code is:
I. Heading 1
I. a. Heading 2
I. b. Heading 3

is it possible to get this?:
I. Heading 1
a. Heading 2
b. Heading 3

P.S.: Sorry for my bad english
posts.raw:
```
#set heading(numbering: "I. a.")
= Heading 1
== Heading 2
== Heading 3
```
the output of this code is:
I. Heading 1
I. a. Heading 2
I. b. Heading 3

is it possible to get this?:
I. Heading 1
a. Heading 2
b. Heading 3

P.S.: Sorry for my bad english

posts.cooked:
Welcome @Konstantin_Vogler,

The simplest option is to use the numbly package.

#import "@preview/numbly:0.1.0": numbly

#set heading(numbering: numbly("{1:I}.", "{2:a}."))

= Heading 1
== Heading 2
== Heading 3
posts.raw:
Welcome @Konstantin_Vogler,

The simplest option is to use the [numbly](https://typst.app/universe/package/numbly) package.

```typst
#import "@preview/numbly:0.1.0": numbly

#set heading(numbering: numbly("{1:I}.", "{2:a}."))

= Heading 1
== Heading 2
== Heading 3
```

![test|283x231](upload://js7PZDeEOpFWilbcmLwlP8vXXBN.png)
